Synonyms

way-out old-fashioned informal

Thesaurus: synonyms, antonyms, and examples

unusualThat's an unusual name - where does it come from?

uncommonIt's not uncommon (= it is common) for people to become ill when they travel.

rareThis is a rare opportunity to visit the building.

unconventionalI had a very unconventional childhood.

uniqueThis is your chance to own a unique piece of jewellery.

See more results »

offbeat

noun [ C ]

music specialized (also mainly UK off-beat) uk/ˈɒf.biːt/ us/ˈɑːf.biːt/

a note in a bar (= one of the small equal parts into which a piece of music is divided) that is not usually accented (= given a special emphasis), such as the second and fourth notes in four-four time:

Each beat has an associated offbeat.

There are a lot of bands that have no rhythm, and should really put in a few offbeats.

Reggae moves away from rock rhythm, often accentuating the off-beats.

More examplesFewer examples

The scattered bass-drum offbeats held the pulse.

Her hips were swaying on the offbeats.

The steady pulse is held down by just bass and hand drum, with occasional handclaps adding unusual offbeats.

The upper strings emphasize the off-beats.

(Definition of offbeat from the Cambridge Advanced Learner's Dictionary & Thesaurus © Cambridge University Press)

Examples of offbeat

offbeat

His little nugget was the song, which is the most offbeat piece of the evening anyway.

That seems a distinct possibility as one listens to the offbeat plans and priorities, and the discordant, irresponsible separatist voices in the wings.
